'''Angus McBride''' ([[11 May]] [[1931]] - [[15 May]] [[2007]]) was a Scottish artist who was already well-established as a military and historical illustrator before working on fantasy art. He mostly worked in gouache, although some of his paintings are in oil.
<ref name=CCGA>{{CCGA|entry=McBride, Angus}}, pp. 183-184</ref><ref>{{ICE|8007}}, p. 4.</ref> 

Fellow Middle-earth artist [[Angelo Montanini]] consider McBride to be the reason he started doing fantasy art.<ref>{{CCGA|entry=Montanini, Angelo}}, p. 192</ref>

==Career==
After a long career illustrating for educational magazines and booklets, he eventually became a main artist for military history publisher Osprey, working on over 90 books between [[1976]] and the early 2000s. For fantasy gaming art, he worked exclusively for [[Iron Crown Enterprises]] in the 1980s and 1990s, who commissioned him to create covers for ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'' and  card art for the ''[[Middle-earth Collectible Card Game|MECCG]]''.<ref name=CCGA/>
